videos.title: Understanding Closures
videos.description: Master JavaScript closures - lexical scope, function factories, and practical applications.

questions.question: What is a closure in JavaScript?
options: A function that closes the browser
A function that has access to variables in its outer scope
A method to close database connections
A way to end a program
questions.explanation: A closure is a function that has access to variables in its outer (enclosing) lexical scope, even after the outer function has returned.

questions.question: When is a closure created?
options: When a function is defined inside another function
questions.explanation: A closure is created when a function is defined inside another function, allowing the inner function to access the outer function's variables.

videos.title: Async JavaScript and Promises
videos.description: Learn asynchronous programming with Promises, async/await, and error handling.

questions.question: What does the 'await' keyword do?
options: Pauses execution until a Promise is resolved
questions.explanation: The 'await' keyword pauses the execution of an async function until the Promise is resolved, making async code look synchronous.

questions.question: Which method is used to handle Promise rejections?
questions.explanation: The .catch() method is used to handle Promise rejections (errors). It catches any errors that occur in the Promise chain.
